name: provincially
content:
provincially adverb
(REGIONALLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
politics
  specialized in a way that relates to a province or provinces (= an area that a country is divided into as part of the organization of its government): The country has a provincially administered system of government health insurance. Elections were held to choose 60 provincially elected members for a four-year term in the National Congress.
More examplesFewer examplesWe are facing numerous economic threats both globally and provincially.Three representatives will be appointed from provincially submitted lists of candidates.

provincially adverb
(LOCALLY)
mainly disapproving in a way that is provincial (= in or from the parts of a country that are not the capital city): Local politicians often act provincially, prioritizing the needs of their district over the greater good. A number of tiny banks established by provincially based entrepreneurs could be about to fail.

provincially adverb
(NATIONALLY)
mainly disapproving in a way that is provincial (= only interested in your own country or region): Once an outward-looking country, it has become provincially inward-looking. We have to stop thinking so provincially about healthcare and start thinking globally. Synonym
parochially
